document.masterDocTitle: The cellophane bees of Colletes Latreille (Hymenoptera: Colletidae) from Xizang (Tibet), China

Colletes floralis
Eversmann, 1852: 46
( lectotype ♂ designated by Proshchalykin & Astafurova 2016: 4: Russia , Orenburg Prov. ,

subSubSection.paragraph:
Spasskoe [ZISP]).
Colletes floralis
; Noskiewicz 1936: 441 ; Osytshnjuk & Romankova 1995: 483 ; Kuhlmann 2000: 180, 2005: 1377, 2009a: 18,

Niu et al . 2013a: 104
, 2014b: 474 ; Proshchalykin & Kuhlmann 2015b: 332 , 2015c: 10 ; Ascher & Pickering 2021 .
Colletes montana Morawitz, 1876: 262
( lectotype ♂ designated by Proshchalykin & Kuhlmann 2015a: 546 : Tajikistan , Yagnob

River near Anzobskii Pass [ZISP]).
Colletes suecica Aurivillius, 1903: 214–215
( syntypes ♀ and ♂ : Central Sweden [SMNH]).
Colletes kudiensis Cockerell, 1924: 594
( holotype ♂ : Russia , Primorsky Terr., Amgu, Kudia River [NHMUK]).
Colletes kudiensis
; Noskiewicz 1936: 437 ; Kuhlmann 1999: 77 ; Proshchalykin 2015: 7.
Colletes montanus
; Popov 1934: 53 .
Colletes yasumatsui Hirashima & Ikudome, 1989: 109
( holotype ♀ : Japan , Yanbetappu, Hokkaido [ELKU]).
Colletes yasumatsui
; Kuhlmann 2000: 181, 2003b: 731.

Diagnosis. Among the
Colletes species
found in Xizang , females of
C. floralis
are unique in having the combination of mesoscutum covered mostly with pale-orange hairs and T2–T3 apical bands 1.75× MOD in lateral view. Males can be recognized through the following set of features: facial and mesosomal black hairs present, malar area 1.25× as long as basal width of mandible and hind basitarsus 5.0× as long as broad.
Colletes floralis
most closely resembles
C. packeri
, but their females can be distinguished by the hind basitarsus with pale setae in the former (hind basitarsus with dark setae in the latter) and T1 with irregularly sparse punctures (i=1.0–1.5 d) medially in the former (T1 with evenly dense (i=0.5 d) punctures in the latter). Males of
C. floralis
are distinct in that the malar is 1.25× as long as basal width of mandible (malar 0.75× as long as basal width of mandible in
C. packeri
) and the gonostylus is nearly straight dorsally (gonostylus concave dorsally in
C. packeri
).

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 2.
Colletes floralis Eversmann, 1852
. Female: (A) habitus, lateral view; (C) face, frontal view. Male: (B) habitus, lateral view; (D) face, frontal view; (E) genital capsule, lateral view; (F) S7, ventral view. Scale bars: (A–D) 2 mm; (E, F) 1 mm.

Distribution. Widespread in the Palaearctic region, particularly in higher latitudes and in mountain regions in the south, ranging from the Iberian Peninsula to as far east as Japan .
DNA barcode. Available ( 3 ♀ and 1 ♂ ). See also Fig. 1 and Table 1 .

Floral hosts. Brassicaceae :
Brassica rapa
L.; Tamaricaceae :
Tamarix sp.

Remarks. Males from the western and easternmost records for
C. floralis
within China ( Xinjiang and Hebei provinces, respectively) exhibit very little morphological variation among themselves, including the shape of their S7.
